studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: Active Comparator A: Diagnosis by Molecular Testing
arms.description: Diagnosis and treatment based on the results of Urine PCR testing. Patients assigned even numbers on randomization table receive treatment guided by urine PCR results using KingFisher Duo Prime, QuantStudio 6 and 7 Flex Real-Time PCR System, and QuantStudio 12k Flex Real-Time PCR System.

arms.name: Active Comparator B: Diagnosis by Conventional Testing
arms.description: Diagnosis and treatment based on the results of Urine Culture and Sensitivity (C&S) testing. Patients assigned odd numbers on randomization table receive treatment guided by urine C&S results.

studyCohorts.name: Recurrent UTI
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with multiple occurrence (â‰¥3) of uncomplicated or complicated UTI in past 12 months

studyCohorts.name: Underlying co-morbidities
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with metabolic disorder (e.g. diabetes), immunosuppression, or impaired renal function (e.g. chronic kidney disease)

studyCohorts.name: Functional and anatomic abnormalities
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with known functional and anatomic abnormalities of the urinary tract (e.g. stones, stents, recent instrumentation, indwelling catheters, neurogenic bladder, or polycystic kidney disease)

studyCohorts.name: Persistent infection
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with persistent infection after primary antibiotic therapy

objectives.name: Primary Objective - Symptomatic Response Evaluation
objectives.text: To evaluate patients' symptomatic responses following diagnosis and treatment based on the results of the molecular method versus those from the conventional urine culture method

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Antibiotic Selection Efficacy
objectives.text: To determine the efficacy of antibiotic selection using molecular method versus the conventional urine culture method

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Clinical Utility Assessment
objectives.text: To assess clinical utility of Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) results during the clinical decision-making phase in patient care

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Antimicrobial Susceptibility Availability
objectives.text: To compare the availability of the antimicrobial susceptibility information from molecular testing and conventional testing at the time of initial antimicrobial therapy

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Diagnostic Agreeability
objectives.text: To quantify the overall agreeability between the diagnostic results generated by PCR versus Culture and Sensitivity (C&S)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Discordant Results Assessment
objectives.text: To assess the symptomatic responses of patients with discordant results [PCR(+), CS(-) and PCR(-), CS(+)]

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Clinically Insignificant Infection Detection
objectives.text: To assess the effectiveness of PCR in avoiding detection of clinically insignificant infections in comparison to the performance of C&S

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint - Favorable Clinical Outcomes
endpoints.text: Number (and percentage) of patients in each study arm with favorable clinical outcomes at the EOS visit. Favorable clinical outcomes are defined as a clinical response of improvement and/or cure. Clinical improvement is defined as 1) Resolution of cUTI signs and symptoms present at baseline, 2) Development of no new cUTI symptoms and/or 3) Avoidance of parenteral antibiotic therapy, in or out of hospital, at any time after randomization. Clinical cure is resolution of all acute signs and symptoms of cUTI and improvement to such an extent that no further antimicrobial therapy (IV or oral) is required for the treatment of the cUTI

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Microbiological Eradication
endpoints.text: Number (and percentage) of patients in each arm with microbiological eradication of all baseline pathogens at the EOS visit. Microbiological eradication of all baseline pathogens is defined as an end of study quantitative urine culture that shows all uropathogens found at baseline are reduced to <105 CFU/mL and all baseline pathogens are not detected by EOS urine PCR (Cq>33)

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Treating Investigator Satisfaction Score
endpoints.text: Subjective measurement of Treating Investigator Satisfaction Score as evaluated by the questionnaire at EOS

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Turnaround Time
endpoints.text: Turnaround Time (as measured in hours) of molecular diagnostic procedures compared to conventional diagnostics (time from collection of samples to complete identification of organism(s) and availability of antimicrobial susceptibility results)

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Diagnostic Agreeability
endpoints.text: Overall agreeability between the diagnostic results generated by PCR versus C&S as assessed by discordant analysis

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Discordant Results Clinical Outcomes
endpoints.text: Assess the favorable clinical outcomes of patients with discordant results [PCR(+), CS(-) and PCR(-), CS(+)]

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint - Negative Percent Agreement
endpoints.text: The negative percent agreement of the PCR test (specificity) compared to C&S in not detecting clinically insignificant UTIs

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint - Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
endpoints.text: Assessment of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE) at EOS

studyInterventions.name: Urine PCR Testing
studyInterventions.description: Molecular diagnostic testing using PCR for diagnosis of complicated urinary tract infection (cUTI) to guide antibiotic treatment selection

studyInterventions.name: Urine Culture and Sensitivity (C&S) Testing
studyInterventions.description: Conventional diagnostic testing using urine culture and sensitivity for diagnosis of complicated urinary tract infection (cUTI) to guide antibiotic treatment selection

activities.name: Informed Consent
activities.description: Obtain written informed consent from participant

activities.name: Demographics
activities.description: Demographics include sex, age, date of birth

activities.name: Randomization
activities.description: Randomization of subject to study arm

activities.name: Vital signs
activities.description: Vital signs include body temperature (Â°C), SBP (mmHg), DBP (mmHg), HR (bpm) and may be conducted by the Investigator at their discretion

activities.name: Adverse events
activities.description: AEs will be collected from the time of informed consent to EOS. Any ongoing AEs at EOS will be followed until resolution or stabilization

activities.name: cUTI treatment
activities.description: cUTI treatment must initiate within 24 hours of receiving the test results (either PCR or C&S as per subject's assigned arm)

notes.text: i Treatment visit (Visit 2) and/or unscheduled visits may be conducted virtually
a Demographics include sex, age, date of birth
b Vital signs include body temperature (Â°C), SBP (mmHg), DBP (mmHg), HR (bpm) and may be conducted by the Investigator at their discretion
c AEs will be collected from the time of informed consent to EOS. Any ongoing AEs at EOS will be followed until resolution or stabilization
d cUTI treatment may continue at EOS and after patient's study exit
e Additional urine testing (PCR, C&S, or both) may be ordered at unscheduled visits at treating Investigator's discretion
f cUTI treatment must initiate within 24 hours of receiving the test results (either PCR or C&S as per subject's assigned arm)

titles.text: Clinical Utility of a PCR Test for the Management of Complicated Urinary Tract Infections in Adults

indications.name: Complicated Urinary Tract Infections
indications.description: Complicated Urinary Tract Infections in Adults

study.name: Clinical Utility of a PCR Test for the Management of Complicated Urinary Tract Infections in Adults

abbreviations.expandedText: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

studyDefinitionDocument.name: Clinical Utility of a PCR Test for the Management of Complicated Urinary Tract Infections in Adults

studyAmendments.summary: Addition of the appendix V. Sub-study: Negative Patient Testing. Addition of exploratory endpoint and analysis plan (sub-study data analysis). Addition of secondary endpoint (discordant analysis).

procedures.name: Urine Sample Collection
procedures.label: Clean-Catch Midstream Urine Collection
procedures.description: Collection of at least 8 mL urine from clean-catch mid-stream urine specimen at V1 and V3

code.decode: Urinalysis, by dip stick or tablet reagent, or both

procedures.name: Urine Culture and Sensitivity
procedures.label: Urine C&S
procedures.description: Urine culture, isolation of uropathogen(s), initial identification of pathogen(s) and bacterial counts using calibrated loop to identify quantitative count at lower limit of 10^5 CFU/mL

code.decode: Culture, bacterial; quantitative colony count, urine

procedures.name: Urine PCR Testing
procedures.label: Urine PCR
procedures.description: Bacterial and fungal pathogen-directed qualitative PCR amplification of target region of 24 uropathogens and 16 different classes of resistance genes

code.decode: Infectious agent detection by nucleic acid, not otherwise specified

procedures.name: Body Temperature Measurement
procedures.label: Temperature
procedures.description: Body temperature measured orally, rectally, or by tympanic route at Visit 1, Visit 3, and unscheduled visits

procedures.name: Blood Pressure Measurement
procedures.label: BP
procedures.description: Blood pressure measurement according to site SOPs at Visit 1, Visit 3, and unscheduled visits

procedures.name: Heart Rate Measurement
procedures.label: HR
procedures.description: Heart rate measurement according to site SOPs at Visit 1, Visit 3, and unscheduled visits

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: PE
procedures.description: Physical examination performed at V1 and V3, may be complete, targeted, or omitted at Investigator's discretion

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit, established patient

procedures.name: Urinary Catheterization
procedures.label: Catheter Collection
procedures.description: Urine sample collection through a newly-placed urinary catheter as per clinical indication

procedures.name: Cystoscopy
procedures.label: Cystoscopy Collection
procedures.description: Urine sample collection via cystoscopy as per clinical indication

procedures.name: Suprapubic Aspiration
procedures.label: Suprapubic Collection
procedures.description: Urine sample collection via suprapubic aspiration as per clinical indication

procedures.name: Informed Consent Process
procedures.label: ICF
procedures.description: Explanation of study and review of consent document with patient, obtaining written informed consent

code.decode: Office visit for evaluation and management

procedures.name: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing
procedures.label: AST
procedures.description: Analysis of purified pathogens for species identification and antimicrobial susceptibility

procedures.name: Vital Signs Assessment
procedures.label: Vitals
procedures.description: Assessment of body temperature, SBP, DBP, and HR at screening, EOS, and unscheduled visits

medicalDevices.name: KingFisher Duo Prime
medicalDevices.label: KingFisher Duo Prime
medicalDevices.description: Molecular testing device for urine PCR analysis and nucleic acid extraction

medicalDevices.name: QuantStudio 6 Flex Real-Time PCR System
medicalDevices.label: QuantStudio 6 Flex
medicalDevices.description: Real-Time PCR System for molecular testing of urine samples

medicalDevices.name: QuantStudio 7 Flex Real-Time PCR System
medicalDevices.label: QuantStudio 7 Flex
medicalDevices.description: Real-Time PCR System for molecular testing of urine samples

medicalDevices.name: QuantStudio 12K Flex Real-Time PCR System
medicalDevices.label: QuantStudio 12K Flex
medicalDevices.description: Real-Time PCR System for molecular testing of urine samples

medicalDevices.name: Calibrated Loop
medicalDevices.label: Calibrated Loop
medicalDevices.description: Calibrated loop for urine culture quantification at lower limit of 10^5 CFU/mL

medicalDevices.name: Blood Pressure Monitor
medicalDevices.label: BP Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Appropriately sized and calibrated equipment for blood pressure measurement

medicalDevices.name: Thermometer
medicalDevices.label: Thermometer
medicalDevices.description: Device for measuring body temperature orally, rectally, or by tympanic route

medicalDevices.name: Urinary Catheter
medicalDevices.label: Urinary Catheter
medicalDevices.description: Newly-placed urinary catheter for urine sample collection

conditions.name: Age Eligibility
conditions.description: Minimum age requirement for study participation
conditions.text: At least 18 years of age at the time of consent

conditions.name: cUTI Signs and Symptoms
conditions.description: Clinical presentation criteria for complicated UTI
conditions.text: Presenting at least two of the following new, persistent or worsening cUTI signs and symptoms: fever (>38Â°C or >100.4Â°F), hypothermia (<35.5Â°C or <95.9Â°F), rigors, chills, dysuria, urinary frequency, urgency, hematuria, suprapubic pain, pelvic pain, CVA tenderness, nausea, vomiting, radiographic evidence of pyelonephritis, leukocytosis

conditions.name: Pyuria Evidence
conditions.text: Urine specimen with evidence of pyuria: dipstick positive for nitrite and/or leukocyte esterase, or â‰¥10 WBCs per mm3, or â‰¥10 WBCs per hpf, or clinically suspected pyuria

conditions.name: High-Risk Patient Population
conditions.text: Elderly (â‰¥65 years), male, pregnant, having recurrent UTI (â‰¥3/year), with underlying co-morbidities (diabetes, immunosuppression, CKD), or with known functional and anatomical abnormalities of the urinary tract

conditions.name: Urine Sample Volume
conditions.text: Able to provide at least 8 mL urine at visit 1 and 3

conditions.name: Chronic Antibiotic Use Definition
conditions.description: Definition of chronic medication use for exclusion
conditions.text: Medication taken daily for â‰¥30 days or used on an as needed basis for â‰¥6 months

transitionRules.name: Screening to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Subject must meet all inclusion criteria (I1-I8) and none of the exclusion criteria (E1-E8)

transitionRules.name: Prior Investigational Product Exclusion
transitionRules.text: Currently participating in or has participated in an interventional clinical trial with an investigational product or device within 30 days prior to the Screening Visit

transitionRules.name: Prior Antibiotic Use Exclusion
transitionRules.text: Receipt of any dose of a potentially therapeutic oral or systemic antibiotics for the treatment of UTI within 48 hours before the study baseline urine is obtained

transitionRules.name: Chronic Antibiotic Use Exclusion
transitionRules.text: Currently on or chronic use of any antibiotics for any clinical indication, other than UTI

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Subject completes the last study-related visit/contact

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Enrollment Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Last subject enrollment will occur when an adequate number of subjects that satisfy the study endpoint criteria are achieved

analysisPopulations.name: Intention-to-Treat Population
analysisPopulations.label: ITT
analysisPopulations.description: All randomized patients who have received at least one dose of study treatment
analysisPopulations.criteria: Randomized and received at least one dose of study treatment

analysisPopulations.name: Modified Intent-To-Treat Population
analysisPopulations.label: Mod-ITT
analysisPopulations.description: All randomized patients who have received at least one dose of study treatment and have at least one post-baseline efficacy assessment
analysisPopulations.criteria: Randomized, received at least one dose of study treatment, and have at least one post-baseline efficacy assessment

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Expansion of study scope to include sub-study for negative patient testing to evaluate PCR test specificity in not detecting clinically insignificant UTIs
Addition of discordant analysis as secondary endpoint to compare PCR test results with culture and sensitivity results

studyChanges.summary: Added new appendix V containing sub-study protocol for negative patient testing

studyChanges.afterText: Exploratory endpoint and analysis plan (sub-study data analysis)
studyChanges.summary: Added exploratory endpoint for sub-study data analysis
Added secondary endpoint for discordant analysis between PCR and C&S results
